description.narrative: Delivering for Results –Support the SDG Implementation through strengthening national capacities in the use of national systems.

participating-org.narrative: United Nations Multi Partner Trust Fund for Somalia

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: -Number of HACT Capacity Assessments -Follow up and implementation of the Risk Management plans. -Improvements in the different elements of the regularly implemented UN Partner Survey, which measures the perception of national partners concerning their cooperation with the international (UN) community -Number of booklets outlining characteristic of the UNDP and Government’s operational environments - Number of Government – UNDP working sessions -LOA management arrangements concerning procurement, recruitment, asset management, financial management, M&E and reporting are aligned with national processes - Number of Government staff trained on oversight and quality control; - Number of UNDP staff trained on work-process implementation management - Number quality control arrangements concerning process and procedural compliance are introduced both at partner and UNDP level. -Clear standards concerning the implementation of work-processes established (Y/N) -Number of staff trained on M&E and reporting arrangements; - Clear standards and operational procedures concerning the implementation of M&E and reporting arrangements and ensure common understanding of applicable rules and regulations; - No, of projects reviewed through Third Party Monitoring arrangements; - No of areas where procedures are aligned, with a focus on measurement, reporting and validation arrangements. - No of knowledge products developed on key project/programme accomplishments and lessons learned - All staff recruited, all progress reports are made and all project boards held.

comment.narrative: -HACT assessments are being implemented. Risk Management and follow up insufficiently consistent -Limited mutual understanding between UN and national counterparts on issues related to international cooperation, processes and procedures -Most of the LOAs management arrangements follow UNDP operational system as a mitigating risk factor in the management of funds. Quality control arrangements regarding process and procedural compliance are available but insufficiently and insufficiently coherently applied.

Improved HACT process will lead to a more consistent and coherent implementation of the cooperation arrangements and contribute to stronger national systems. - More insight in the operational environment will improve and contribute to enhanced national implementation and use of national systems. - Better oversight & control and more aligned operational systems are expected to contribute to more efficient implementation. - Strengthened M&E systems are expected to contribute to better Strengthened M&E systems are expected to contribute to management, sharper and faster decision making that is more tuned into the development contex

- HACT Assurance Plan for 2019 developed, approved and implemented -Micro assessment conducted for responsible parties to inform HACT compliance - Spot checks conducted for 23 partners - HACT financial audit and DIM audit implemented. Reports uploaded and recommendations implemented - RBM training conducted for CO staff - Capacity building informed by spot checks reports implemented - Third-party monitoring implemented for all quarters

- HACT Assurance Plan for 2020 to be developed and implemented -Micro assessment to be conducted for expired reports - Spot checks conducted for partners in line with risk rating - HACT and DIM audit implemented - Improved M&E planning and implementation - Capacity building of partners and staff implemented - Third-party monitoring implemented

- HACT assurance plan for 2020 developed, approved and implemented - Micro assessments updated and carried out to inform programme risk management - Spot checks conducted for 95 partners involving government and CSOs - HACT audit conducted virtually for 20 partners - Strengthened M&E team, with annual plan developed and implemented, to inform CO reporting at various levels - Third party monitoring for verification of activities and indicator data collection implemented.
Not applicable. The project is financially closed.
Not applicable. The project is financially closed.
